[Music]
you
[Music]
hi and welcome you listening to the x22
rapport my name's Dave and this is
episode 1652 a and today's date is
August 30th 2018 and the title of the
episode is we are witnessing the nation
being prepared for a new economic system
let's get into the economic collapse
financial news now we need to understand
one thing that is pretty darn important
this entire system is going to be coming
down and it's being prepped right now in
a certain way to allow the United States
to move forward after it the central
banking system is gone they take it over
they nationalize a Federal Reserve no
longer independent and the people
control it it's completely transparent
there's no more loaning currency to the
government where the people have to pay
it back so what we're seeing right now
is every step that Trump is taking it's
preparing the economy for this this is
not for this economy that we're in right
now where we see him talking about
manufacturing talking about bilateral
trade agreements talking about how great
the economy's doing the reason why the
economy is doing well is he's using the
same exact approach the deep state the
central bankers have used all along
manipulation and he's manipulating this
economy and using it to allow the
country to prepare for the next system I
mean really think about it if he came
out and he said the economy is dead in
the water the stock market is fake it's
fictitious it's a bubble it's gonna pop
it's being driven higher and higher by
the Fed all the numbers that were
reporting on are completely fake phony
and false what would happen right now
well first of all the economy is not
prepared for anything it would just
collapse people would be freaked out why
is this happening why is this all
manipulated and the US would take years
upon years
to recover instead let's drive these
numbers up higher and push this economy
to the edge using the central bank and
the deep state and what they've done in
the past and that is what he's doing
right now he is using this saying that
it's doing fantastically which enables
him to take funds use it for
infrastructure he has the ability now to
make the bilateral trade agreements to
say the u.s. is doing well so we can
make these agreements and he's using all
of this not just him but those people
that are behind him working with him to
build this system up for the transition
and what what better way to do this but
with the central bank's funny-money why
don't we just use their funds to build
the u.s. the back to the way it was and
this is what's happening right now
because once the central bank goes down
all this debt they're gonna say null and
void because they're gonna go into their
books they're going to audit them
they're gonna find out that the central
bank has not been honest to the American
people and most of the debt and most of
what they've done was completely against
their charter and everything most likely
by then will be null and void and we
could see that it is definitely playing
out this way now remember the Fed is
looking at the data and I believe Powell
is definitely working with Trump on this
to bring the Fed to the very very edge
and this is why they're going at each
other and this is why Trump is calling
out the Fed just like Trump and sessions
where they're making everyone look at
this situation where they're very angry
with each other while other things are
happening in the background so we know
the Fed they're going to raise most
likely the interest rates in September
which is going to have a disaster as the
fact
on the economy especially the housing
market and everything like this and
Trump definitely wants the Fed to raise
these rates to start bringing down the
system in this way they can turn around
and blame it on the Fed the other thing
is they're waiting to hit that inflation
mark of 2% you know because that's the
magic number and that means yes we can
raise rates because we want to make sure
that we keep the economy from
overheating but we know that's the
opposite we know that they're raising
the rates not to keep the economy from
overheating but actually to overheat the
economy and bring it down so right now
the growth rate of Americans spending
while that has slowed in the last three
months but they're telling us how great
online sales were income growth has
slowed so we have spending slowing
income growth slowing at the same time
and if we look at the income growth we
see government employees they have been
getting raises and their growth has been
going up very interesting the private
sector wages have been going down now
this is very interesting because during
Obama's reign people were getting raises
salaries were pushed up everyone was
dependent on what the government well
they can't be dependent on the
government anymore the government cannot
support the number of people working for
them the debt is too high everything
cannot be sustained and it's going to be
disaster and we'll see and we'll talk
about what Trump is doing to counter all
of this and eventually what he'll do is
start removing some of these positions
which he's already started to do so we
see the personal savings rate that has
been declining also of course people are
making the same amount of money so the
savings rate is going down people are
going further into debt growth wages
spending all falling at the same time
but the Fed wants inflation now think
about this for a sec
people are making less money they're not
going out spending their savings rate is
declining and the Fed is looking for
inflation and that will hurt the
everyday person this way they can raise
the interest rates and once again this
is going to affect the housing market
the student loan market the automobile
market because remember over the many
many years they've been suppressing the
interest rates so people would purchase
cars and go into debt go to college go
into debt buy a house go into debt take
loans out on their credit cards go into
debt take home equity line of credit out
on their mortgage go into debt further
debt and we see at this time that
they're going to raise the rates now
once they start doing this once again
the housing market is gonna start to
fall and to start to fall apart much
much faster the automobile industry
they're gonna have a tougher time people
are gonna have a tougher time getting
student loans and it's all going to
start to fall apart now if we look at
the federal employer Trump made an
announcement that government worker
wages are going to be frozen now these
are non-military
federal employees we have a lot of those
Trump explains in a letter to Congress
using emergency policies put into place
in case of serious economic conditions
affecting the general welfare and this
is what it says dear Mr Speaker I am
transmitting an alternative plan for pay
adjustments for civilian federal
employees covered by the general
schedule and certain other pay systems
in January 2019
title 5 United States Code authorized me
to implement alternative plans for pay
adjustments for civilian federal
employees covered by the general
schedule and certain other pay systems
if because of national emergency or
serious economic and
affecting the general welfare I view the
increases that would otherwise take
effect as inappropriate under current
law locally locality pay increases
averaging twenty five point seven zero
percent caustic twenty five billion will
go into effect in January 2019 in
addition to a 2.1 percent
across-the-board increase for the base
General Schedule we must maintain
efforts to put our nation on a fiscally
sustainable course and federal agency
budgets cannot sustain such increases
accordingly I have determined that it is
appropriate to exercise my authority to
set alternative across-the-board and
locality pay adjustments for 2019
specifically I have determined that for
2019 both across-the-board pay increases
and locality pay increases will be set
to zero now let's think about this for a
second we have the GDP numbers coming
out and therefore percent unemployment
is very very low everything seems like
it's doing fantastically the economy is
humming along well Trump is the master
of making everyone think and believe
that the economy is doing very very well
and while he's doing this he's convinced
many in government many in the
mainstream media many people in the
country that we can use this funny money
the money from the Fed to do certain
things certain projects now on the other
hand with this economy doing so
fantastically he's going to use national
emergency or serious economic conditions
affecting the general welfare and this
is the emergency policies for an economy
that's not doing well so when we think
about this and we think about this and
go I'm gonna go back in time before
Trump came into office he knew that the
stock market was a bubble he knew that
the Federal Reserve pretty much was
corrupt
he knew that we had a spending problem
and there were a lot of bubbles in the
economy housing and everything else this
he all knew and he still knows this and
when he became president and he found
out all this information to be
absolutely real and he sees that it
matches with what he's been saying he
can't come out to the general public
because the economy would implode right
there and then and we wouldn't be able
to prepare for a new system so this is
why Trump decided not to say anything at
this time because he knew and not just
him but others they knew they were going
to have to prepare this economy for the
next economic system why do you think he
struck down TPP why did he renegotiate
NAFTA why did he cut programs he's doing
all this for a specific reason yes the
debt is going up because why not use the
free money right now
to build the economy up to where we
needed to be for the new system and just
from Trump going out there and putting
the pay raise to zero
that should tell you something because
if the economy was doing really really
well he wouldn't have to do this but he
stopped the funding to Middle East
he stopped funding in other areas and
you're gonna see individuals being cut
people being laid off in government this
all has to be done prior to us moving to
a new system to make it easier for the
masses because if he just mentioned the
stock market was a bubble everything I
thought was all true and everything is
fake phony and false everything's
manipulated we're doomed well we would
all be doomed it would be a nightmare
there'd be riots to be civil war to be
you name it it would all happen remember
those in power the central bank the
they were planning on something
completely different to explain away why
the economy was failing why you couldn't
get food why you couldn't get supplies
why you couldn't get food why you
couldn't get medical supplies this was
going to be because of a war and it
would be a great excuse I mean go back
to the 1970s when we're coming off the
gold standard and we're moving on to the
petro dollar what was their narrative oh
we can't find any more oil we have a big
shortage and this is why you have to
sacrifice and drive slower in the United
States they lower the speed limit to 55
because they told us how much fuel that
would save us theirs they were saying
that we had no fuel we couldn't find any
this is why there were lines no we were
moving off the gold standard and moving
on to the central bankers new system and
their narrative was there was a shortage
of oil there was no shortage there was
plenty of oil there was plenty of what
we needed but that was their excuse
don't you think it's odd that we had a
shortage and all of a sudden how many
years later 47 years later we've been
okay I mean think about the population
has increased the number of automobiles
has increased we fly more planes now we
drive more trucks now we use fuel in
everyday life and we're doing it 10
times than what we were doing in the
1970s so when we think about this we
need to use logic we need to understand
what is going on here and we're getting
prepared and ready for this major
transition that's what is going on right
now so everyone needs to be prepared and
ready for this transition
listen everyone thanks a lot for
listening be well be safe and especially
be prepared thanks a lot
[Music]
[Music]
you
you
